[[size 75%]]This is a series showing off news from the site, articles from the past month[[footnote]] with a rating above 0 [[/footnote]], and fan-content for you to check out and discover! Be sure to leave a comment with your thoughts![[/size]]

++++* Fandom Stuff

* The **[[[Collaboration Contest]]]** that started the previous month has ended. Congratulations to the winners! Be sure to check out all the entries on the contest page.

* The Seminars and Workshops initiative has had an active month. Seminars on providing quick crit and finding and using CC-compliant images were carried out over IRC. Check the **[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com.forum/t-10752847/seminars-and-workshops#post-4193637 Seminars and Workshops]** post for schedule of upcoming events.

++++* Featured Articles

* [[[SCP-2886]]] ("Planet-Hopping Volcano") - //Since it was discovered on Triton, SCP-2886 has teleported 10 times.// Written by Multiscoop

* [[[SCP-3052]]] ("Disturbed") - //However, it was discovered that any subject viewing SCP-3052-1 will perceive it as facing them directly, no matter which angle or direction the subject views it from.// Written by Witryso

* [[[Being Cactusman]]] - //What few scientists bother to worry about is whether or not plants dream. They do.// Written by Riemann

* [[[LTE-2712-Bosch]]] - //A series of teeth (40 confirmed instances) which appeared spontaneously in and above the Arctic Ocean on 04/08/2███.// Written by shaggydredlocks

++++* Reviewer's Spotlight Articles

* [[[SCP-1169]]] ("Lamarck's Giraffe") - //Assignment preference will be given to staff who are irreversibly infertile.// Written by wishun, selected by //wishun//

* [[[SCP-3844]]] ("To Slay A Dragon") - //A dragon. There was a dragon in the mountains. And it looked just like we'd imagined.// Written by Captain Kirby, selected by //DrSevere//

* [[[SCP-3881]]] ("A Disregarded Proposal") - //When worn by a human being, SCP-3881 will immediately transport the wearer to an unknown location.// Written by Ayers, selected by //RockTeethMothEyes//

* [[[you never visit anymore | You Never Visit Me Anymore]]] - //She pushed page after page into my hands, always littered with notes and lines under words, in red Sharpie.// Written by Zachary Maxwell, selected by //Zachary Maxwell//


[[f>toc]]

----

You will notice little '📈' emojis beside some articles. That denotes SCP articles which were under 30 and tales which were under 20 when this edition of site news was posted. Give them a little love! Speaking from personal experience, the most frustrating thing that can happen to an article is not deletion, but stagnating below 20 without any comments. So try to read, vote, and comment on these articles! They're often hidden gems :)

+++ Week of July 1st:

* 📈[[[scp-4307| SCP-4307]]] ("Electro-Marine Praetorian") - Sounds like one hell of a new music genre. Written by DL_Baryonyx.

* [[[scp-4338| SCP-4338]]] ("Vulcan, the Disaster") - A comedy of errors. Written by T Rutherford.
* [[[scp-4838| SCP-4838]]] ("Lover's Quarrel") - A huge bummer. Written by aismallard.
* [[[scp-4587| SCP-4587]]] ("A Dog's Purpose") - LOVE DOG YES. Written by daveyoufool.

* [[[scp-4257| SCP-4257]]] ("public transit by dado") - you take car yes i mean pill yes. Written by Nameless Mediocre.
* 📈[[[scp-4665| SCP-4665]]] ("The Caprine Conspiracy") - God damn goats. Written by BlackMagicFine.
* [[[scp-4766| SCP-4766]]] ("My Beautiful, Beautiful Son") -  MaliceAforethought's beautiful, beautiful son.
* [[[scp-4792| SCP-4792]]] ("The Contingency") - The plan is to scream. In patterns. Written by YossiLeiner.
* 📈[[[scp-4965| SCP-4965]]] ("My name is Legion for we are many") - WE ARE MANY. AN ARMY. A LEGION. Written by DanMoss.
* [[[scp-445-ex| SCP-445-EX]]] ("The word of the day is Hope") - The magic just isn't there anymore. Written by DarkStuff.
* [[[scp-4710| SCP-4710]]] ("Sheen Gojira") - Sheen from Jimmy Neutron has never been so big. Written by A Random Day.
* [[[scp-4813| SCP-4813]]] ("My only way out is to forget I ever need a way out.") - For when escape is impossible. Written by NatVoltaic.
* 📈[[[scp-4825| SCP-4825]]] ("Like a lake lake, bake a bake cake.") - a literal hot seat. Written by RadioactiveRADS.





++++ Tales

* [[[no-smoking| No Smoking]]] - //“You know how many Class-D died last year, Dolarhyde?”// Written by Bennings.
* 📈[[[her-final-thoughts| Her Final Thoughts]]] - "//There was bound to be someone meant to watch over him.//" Written by Mew-ltiverse.

++++ GoI Formats


* [[[nicos-stupid-proposal| Uncle Nicolini's Proposal… Maybe.]]] - [SPC] It's lonely at the top. Written by Uncle Nicolini.

* 📈[[[scp-4867| SCP-4867]]] ("Wyoming Territory, 1867-1870") - Many Wyomings. Written by Tufto.
* 📈[[[scp-4819| SCP-4819]]] ("Never Miss the Last Day of Summer") - There's 104 days of summer vacation, and hi im stel has NO PLANS to end them!

* [[[scp-281-fr| SCP-281-FR]]] ("The Snooze Alarm") - SAPPHIRE is back at it! Translated by Lt Flops and DrMacro.

* [[[the-existential-maw-of-despair-national-park| The "Existential Maw Of Despair" National Park!]]] - //"She likes to stare at it. Doesn't seem to affect her much, though."// Written by Tufto.
* [[[thullsh-t| θullsh't]]] - "//You have to sleep, Ray. Or your work is gonna suffer and then we’re all in deep shit.//" Written by Oboebandgeek99.
* 📈[[[uocs-broadside| UOCS Broadside]]] - "//Time to make a choice.//" Written by BlueJones.

There are a couple of examples of diverse art styles from each branch presented in thumbnails here. If you click through to the different branches' artwork hubs you will see lots of artwork pages for individual artists and events. There is an immense amount of great art there that users of this English language wiki rarely get exposed to.

+* Q&A:

++* Q: Can I replace a blurb that you wrote for one of my articles with my own? I'm not satisfied with it.

A: Absolutely. You will always have that option at any point.

++* Q: I noticed an error/typo/incorrect information and wish to correct it. May I?

A: Sure! If the changes are not limited to your own article(s) and/or are substantial changes across multiple entries, you should post in that month's discussion page and then make the changes.

++* Q: I wrote an article and it seems to have stuck. Can I send a blurb of mine to one of the frequent collaborators?

A: Yup! It's much easier if you come to us about it, and it gives you the control over what you want shown on the news page.
